result.execSummary:
The defendant Elijah Patrick Krueger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine/costs to be paid at a rate of $100.00 per month commencing 12-01-2022 and each month thereafter or penalty of civil judgment entered for non payment.

Costs to be paid with fine payment.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Elijah Patrick Krueger

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Nikole Kane.
Defendant Elijah Patrick Krueger in court.  Attorney Brandon K. Carlson in court for Elijah Patrick Krueger.

Court conducts a plea colloquy with the defendant.
Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to count 1.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 1.
Count 2 is dismissed as a read in.

Court orders the following:	
Fine:  $568
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $200
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid at the rate of $100 per month, starting 12/01/2022 and the 1st of every month until paid in full.
Alternate:  Entry of a Civil Judgment
Pre-trial conference on October 28, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

1:59 PM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe.  Defendant Elijah Patrick Krueger in court.  Attorney Brandon K. Carlson in court for Elijah Patrick Krueger. 

The Court goes over the procedural history of the case.
The State gives its bail recommendation.
The Defense gives its bail recommendation.
The Court quashes the warrant.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

11:42 AM Defendant Elijah Patrick Krueger not in court.  Attorney Brandon K. Carlson in court for Elijah Patrick Krueger. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder. 
Defense has no indication of their clients whereabouts. 
State motions the Court to issue a warrant for the defendant and to revoke and forfeit any bail. 
Defense requests that capias be stayed.
Court issues a Capias and revokes and forfeits bond.
